txt.en: A Strange Trail
Find the Orc-corpses to the north
Summon Cyneberg to your side
'And another. Whoever did this is strong, [placeholder]. I hope we can count them a friend....'
Cyneberg has given you a whistle to summon her.\n\nYou should summon Cyneberg to your side.

You gently tell Cyneberg that it would be best to leave, and head back to Forlaw.

'You are right. How will we tell GÃ¡rwig that there is no hope for Wildermore, [placeholder]?

'I do not want to face him after I behaved so foolishly. I was so full of hope! That is done now.'

The best path can be found south-west of Grimnesberg's crest. Cyneberg can be summoned using the whistle should you become separated.\n\nYou should head south-west with Cyneberg to begin your return to Forlaw, and speak with her when she is ready.

'Did you kill these Orcs, [placeholder]? You did well -- I did not see them when I came here.'

You tell Cyneberg that it was not you who killed the three Orcs at your feet.

Cyneberg looks confused, but says nothing.
Another pile of Orcs can be found north-west of the first in the eastern High Knolls.\n\nYou should investigate the Orcs with Cyneberg.

'This is terribly strange. Who could be doing this? We have no heroes left in Wildermore.

'Are there two of you, [placeholder]?

'I think there are more up ahead. Let us follow them.'
Another pile of Orcs can be found north of the first in the eastern High Knolls.\n\nYou should investigate the Orcs with Cyneberg.
'This was deftly done. It... it reminds me of Thrymm. But it was not he.'\n\nCyneberg's voice cracks as she speaks.
Another pile of Orcs can be found north of the first in the eastern High Knolls.\n\nYou should investigate the Orcs with Cyneberg.
'Who did this, [placeholder]? It is a mystery.'\n\nYou cannot help but wonder if Thrymm has returned from the dead, but you keep your thoughts to yourself.
'[placeholder]...? Cyneberg! What are you doing here?'
Whoever killed the Orcs is hiding somewhere in the far north-eastern High Knolls.\n\nYou should search for whoever killed the Orcs
'I cannot believe it! Thrymm! Is it really you?'
Cyneberg is at your side.\n\nYou should speak with Cyneberg.
Another pile of Orcs can be found north of the first in the eastern High Knolls.\n\nYou should investigate the Orcs with Cyneberg.
You have called Cyneberg to your side
Cyneberg did not kill these Orcs, and neither did you...
Summon Cyneberg to your side
You should talk to Cyneberg here
You should speak with Cyneberg at an ideal resting spot
Cyneberg kneels at a pile of slain Orcs in the northern High Knolls.\n\nYou should speak with Cyneberg.
Another cluster of dead Orcs can be found to the north
Investigate the Orc-corpses to the north-west
You should talk to Cyneberg here
Investigate the Orc-corpses to the north
Cyneberg is reminded of Thrymm by this handiwork...
Find the Orc-corpses to the north
This is not a good place to stop and talk
Find whoever killed the Orcs
This is not a good place to stop and talk
You should talk to Cyneberg here
This is not a good place to stop and talk

This is not a good place to stop and talk
Many more Orcs have been recently killed here
You have found Thrymm! He is alive...battered and bruised, but alive.
This is not a good place to talk to Cyneberg
You and Cyneberg have decided that it's time to leave Grimnesberg and head back to Forlaw in defeat.
Talk to Cyneberg
You have called Cyneberg to your side
